moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Basic Theory and Practices/04 Algorithmic Reality/Gaming the Algorithm

overview.quote: When gaming the algorithm, you're really gaming people's psychology.
overview.introText: Learn how to create content that naturally generates high engagement by understanding what drives viewers to watch, comment, share, and interact with short-form videos.

keyTerms.definition: Any viewer interaction (likes, comments, shares, saves) that signals interest to the algorithm and extends platform time.
In algorithm terms, not about inherent value but ability to generate viewer interaction and emotional response.
Understanding the mindset of distracted, tired, or passive viewers and creating content that cuts through attention barriers.
Content elements that provoke strong enough feelings that viewers feel compelled to engage rather than scroll past.

actionPlan: List 3 ways to make your topic controversial
Create content that demands a response
Review comments to identify emotional triggers
Test videos with a "would you share this?" filter

mainContent.title: Engagement Is Everything
mainContent.text: The algorithm's primary metric is engagement—not just views or watch time, but active interactions. A video with 1,000 comments will usually outperform one with none, regardless of view count.

mainContent.title: Redefine "Good Content"
mainContent.text: In short-form, "good" means engagement-generating, not necessarily high-quality or valuable. Content that creates conversation—even controversy—signals value to algorithms.

mainContent.title: The Two Key Questions
mainContent.text: To predict algorithm success, ask: 1) Would the average person watch this out of choice? 2) Is there a reason for them to comment, share, or engage? Two "yes" answers predict success.

proTips.text: The best videos create a psychological tension that can only be relieved by commenting or sharing—like an unanswered question or bold claim.

finalWords.description: Create content so emotionally impactful viewers can't scroll past without engaging.
